paper_metadata.title: Livelihood Impact of Tanzania Social Action Fund Intervention on Rural Vulnerable Groups

program_information.target_population: Rural vulnerable groups including food insecure, vulnerable groups, service poor

component_b_assets.assets_evidence_citation: This study was conducted to assess the livelihood impact of Tanzania Social Action Fund intervention on rural vulnerable groups... This particular research analysed the impact of productive assets created on socio-economic activities of the recipients after intervention.

study_characteristics.outcomes_evidence_citation: Results showed that participation had positive significant effect (p<0.05) on socio-economic status... findings showed that there were a positive significant correlation among women associations (p<0.01), women participation and income generating activities (p<0.05) with socio-economic status
study_characteristics.design_evidence_citation: A sample of 239 recipients and 115 nonrecipients were collected through a stratified cross sectional quasi-experimental design

evidence_citations.program_name_citation: This study was conducted to assess the livelihood impact of Tanzania Social Action Fund intervention on rural vulnerable groups in Makete and Rungwe Districts
evidence_citations.country_citation: This study was conducted to assess the livelihood impact of Tanzania Social Action Fund intervention on rural vulnerable groups in Makete and Rungwe Districts
evidence_citations.target_population_citation: Since, all districts adopted TASAF intervention for heterogeneity needy groups... stratified list of participants: food insecure (FI); community development investment (CDI); vulnerable groups (VGs); and service poor (SP) projects were used as the sampling frame
